children.value: Graph is the carrier of G6. All the operations about events, behaviors, items are mounted on the instance of Graph.
The life cycle of an instance of Graph is: Initialize -> Load data -> Render -> Update -> Destroy.
The DOM container of graph, it can be the id of a DOM element or the an HTML node.
The width of the canvas for graph with the unit 'px'.
The height of the canvas for graph with the unit 'px'.
Whether to fit the canvas to the view port.
. It is the padding between canvas and the border of view port.
- It can be a value, e.g.
, which means the padding to the top, left, right, bottom are the same.
, the four values in the array indicate the padding to the top, right, bottom, left respectively.

Whether to group the nodes and edges separately. When it is false, all the items (including nodes and edges) are in the same group, and the order/zindex of them are determined according to the order of their generation.
Whether to paint the graph automatically while item updated or view port changed. In order to enhance the performance, we recommend to turn off
when you are doing bulk operation on nodes or edges. This can be refered to
The interaction modes of this graph. Please refer to
The node styles on different states, e.g. hover, selected. It is a new feature of G6 3.1.
The edge styles on different states, e.g. hover, selected. It is a new feature of G6 3.1.
Default node configurations in global, including type, size, color and so on. Its priority is lower than the configurations in data.
Default edge configurations in global, including type, size, color and so on. Its priority is lower than the configurations in data.
Plugins for graph. Please refer to
Wheter activate the global animation. Which will take effect while changing layouts, changing data, and other global operations.
The configurations for global animation. Takes effect only when
The callback function for every frame of animation. The path of custom animation for node can be defined here. The nodes will move linearly when
Duration of animation with unit millisecond.
The easing function name of animation. Please refer to ease in d3.
Group style for nodes, please refer to
in it is the name of layout method with the options:
. For more configurations for different layout methods, please refer to
Render the graph with Canvas or SVG. It is supported expecting V3.3.x
In G6 3.1, we added two new configurations for graph:
. In the same time, we deleted
, and keep the sub-configuration inside them.
Place the configurations in the paramter as below to instantiate a graph:
Graph data, it should be an object containing an array of nodes and an array of edges.
// graph is an instance of Graph
Render the graph with data onto the canvas.
Render a node group according to the data.
// graph is an instance of Graph
Read the data and render the graph. It is equal to combining graph.data(data) and graph.render().
Graph data, it should be an object containing an array of nodes and an array of edges.
// graph is an instance of Graph
Change the data source, and render the graph according to the new data.
Graph data, it should be an object containing an array of nodes and an array of edges. If it is not assigned, the graph will be re-rendered with the current data on the graph
// graph is an instance of Graph
// If there is no parameter, the graph will be re-rendered with the current data on the graph
Collapse the group with groupId. After collapsing, the nodes and edges inside the group will be hided, the edges linking inside nodes and outside nodes will be linked to the group.
Expand the group to show the inside nodes and edges, and the edges linking inside nodes and outside nodes will be restored.
Add item(node, edge, or group) to the graph.
The type of the item. Options:
The data model of the item. When
// Here is the model example for type = 'group'
Update the item with new data model.
The id or the instance of the item.
// Find the item instance by id
Remove the item. When the item is the id of a group, this operation will delete the corresponding group.
The id or the instance of the item.
// Find the item instance by id
Refresh the canvas when the data is changed.
The id or the instance of the item.
// Find the item instance by id
When the positions of nodes in their data models are changed, refresh the canvas to paint the nodes with new positions. It will update the edges in the same time.
Repaint the canvas. Use it after changing the item's style or state.
Whether to repaint the canvas automatically after updating or deleting items.
Whether to repaint the canvas automatically.
There are several basic layout algorithms in G6 3.1. For more information, please refer to
Re-layout the graph with current layout configurations in graph.
is a string and it is different from current layout method,
will change the layout method and relayout;
will relayout with current layout method and new layout configurations.
// configure the layout while instantializing the graph, and update the layout in somewhere you want.
Clear all the items in the canvas. This function is used for reseting the data source and re-rendering the graph.
The id or the instance of the item.
// Find the item instance by id
The id or the instance of the item.
// Find the item instance by id
The id or the instance of the item.
The value of state. State can be comstomized as selected, hover, actived, and so on.
Clear the states of the item. This function could clear multiple states in the same time.
The id or the instance of the item.
// Clear single state 'a' of the node
// Clear multiple states of the node
// Clear all the states of the node
Set the style and other configurations for each node.
. It does not take effect otherwise.
Return the configurations for each node.
Set the style and other configurations for each edge.
. It does not take effect otherwise.
Return the configurations for each edge.
Add interaction behaviors to a mode or multiple modes.
The name(s) of behavior(s) to be added.
// Add single behavior 'click-select' to a single mode 'default'
// Add multiple behaviors to single mode 'default'
// Add single behavior 'brush-select' to multiple modes
// Add multiple behaviors to multiple modes
The name(s) of behavior(s) to be removed.
// remove single behavior 'click-select' from single mode 'default'
// remove multiple behaviors from single mode 'default'
// remove single behavior 'brush-select' from multiple modes
// remove multiple behaviors from multiple modes
Switch the interaction mode of graph. For example, switch from edit mode to read-only mode.
The return value indicates the current mode.
// The return value is the current interaction mode

The return value indicates the current zoom ratio of view port. The default value is 1.
// The return value indicates the current zoom ratio
Change the zoom ratio. The parameter ratio is the related ratio about the current canvas.
is ignored, this operation will zoom the graph with the current graph center.
// Zoom at graph center with ratio 0.5
Zoom the canvas at the center to a fixed ratio.
is ignored, this operation will zoom the graph with the current graph center.

Move the graph to center at the item. This operation can be used as easing animation after searching a node.
The id or the instance of the item.
Change the size of the canvas.
Fit the graph to the view port.
The padding of [top, right, bottom, left].
// When padding is a number, top = right = bottom = left = 20
// When padding is an array with 2 values, top = bottom = 20, right = left = 10
// When padding is an array with four values

In this part, we will describe the methods about transformation between view port, canvas, and client coordinates. The relationships between them are shown below:

Type of the return value: Object;
'The x and y of client/screen are: '
Transform canvas coordinates into view port coordinates.
Type of the return value: Object;
'The x and y of view port: '
Transform view port coordinates into canvas coordinates.
The x coordinate of view port.
The y coordinate of view port.
Type of the return value: Object;
'The x and y coordinates of canvas: '
Update the node positions according to the data model animatively. The
of the graph will be the animation configurations.
Stop the animation on the canvas.
Return if the graph is animating.
Get an property of graph by key.
Set the value to an property.
Export the whole graph as an image, whatever (a part of) the graph is out of the screen.
The name of the image. 'graph' by default.
The configuration for the exported image, detials are shown below
is the configuration for exported image:
The background color of the image. If it is not assigned, the background will be transparent.
The top, right, bottom, right paddings of the exported image. When its type is number, the paddings around the graph are the same
Export the canvas as an image.
The name of the image. 'graph' by default.
The background color of the image. If it is not assigned, the background will be transparent.
Generate url of a image of the canvas.
The type of the image, options:
The background color of the image. If it is not assigned, the background will be transparent.
Type of the return value: String;
The return value is the image url.

markdownRemark.tableOfContents:
• Initialize

    • G6.Graph

  • Load Data

    • data(data)

  • Render

    • render()
    • renderCustomGroup(data, groupType)
    • read(data)
    • changeData(data)
    • collapseGroup(groupId)
    • expandGroup(groupId)

  • Update

    • addItem(type, model)
    • add(type, model)
    • updateItem(item, model)
    • update(item, model)
    • removeItem(item)
    • remove(item)
    • refresh()
    • refreshItem(item)
    • refreshPositions()
    • paint()
    • setAutoPaint(auto)

  • Layout

    • layout()
    • updateLayout(cfg)

  • Destroy

    • clear()
    • destroy()

  • State

    • showItem(item)
    • hideItem(item)
    • setItemState(item, state, enabled)
    • clearItemStates(item, states)
    • node(nodeFn)
    • edge(edgeFn)

  • Interaction

    • addBehaviors(behaviors, modes)
    • removeBehaviors(behaviors, modes)
    • setMode(mode)
    • getCurrentMode()
    • on(eventName, handler)
    • off(eventName, handler)
    • off(eventName)
    • off()
    • getZoom()
    • zoom(ratio, center)
    • zoomTo(toRatio, center)
    • focusItem(item)
    • changeSize(width, height)
    • translate(dx, dy)
    • moveTo(x, y)
    • fitView(padding)

  • Search

    • find(type, fn)
    • findById(id)
    • findAll(type, fn)
    • findAllByState(type, state)

  • Data

    • save()
    • getNodes()
    • getEdges()

  • Coordinate Transformation

    • getPointByClient(clientX, clientY)
    • getClientByPoint(x, y)
    • getPointByCanvas(canvasX, canvasY)
    • getCanvasByPoint(x, y)

  • Animation

    • positionsAnimate()
    • stopAnimate()
    • isAnimating()

  • Others

    • addPlugin(plugin)
    • removePlugin(plugin)
    • get(key)
    • set(key, val)
    • downloadFullImage(name, imageConfig)
    • downloadImage(name, backgroundColor)
    • toDataURL()
